metadata.title: Environmental Impact, Concept and Measurement of

abstract.original_text: Biological integrity Wholeness of a living system, including the capacity to sustain the full range of organisms and processes having evolved in a region. Biosphere The thin layer of life at or near the surface of the Earth. Biota Living things, in particular, the flora and fauna of a region. Biotic impoverishment Systematic reduction in Earth's capacity to support life.

sentences.segment_text: Biological integrity Wholeness of a living system ,
including the capacity to sustain the full range of organisms and processes having evolved in a region .
Biosphere The thin layer of life at or near the surface of the Earth .
the flora and fauna of a region .
Biotic impoverishment Systematic reduction in Earth 's capacity to support life .

abstract.original_text: Ecosystem engineers Organisms that physically shape their environment, including organisms that create or modify the environments of other organisms. Environment Surroundings; the complex of physical, chemical, and biotic factors acting upon a living system and influencing its form, function, and survival. Health A flourishing condition, well-being; capacity for self-renewal. Impact A forceful contact; a major effect of one thing on another.

Environment Surroundings ; the complex of physical ,
chemical , and biotic factors acting upon a living system and influencing its form , function , and survival .

Impact A forceful contact ; a major effect of one thing on another .
